main event: A memorandum discussing the handling of UFO reports by the Air Force in response to inquiries from the McClellan Subcommittee.
interesting points: The McClellan Subcommittee conducted informal discussions about Air Force handling of UFO reports in January 1958., The Committee expressed concerns about alleged withholding of information by the Air Force., The Air Force reassured the Committee that they do not withhold information and have a public information plan regarding UFOs., Major Donald Keyhoe suggested potential Congressional hearings on UFO operations., Various Air Force officials and FBI investigators participated in discussions regarding the necessity of these hearings.
witness description: Air Force officials and Committee investigators
